title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: The Earl of Crawford was created Duke ofMontrose, Lord Kilmaurs was raised to the rank of Earl Glencairn, andthe Lairds of Balnamoon, Lag, Balyard, and others, received grants ofland.

title: The Letters of Robert Louis Stevenson - Volume 2
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: There came one day to lunch at the house two very formidable old ladies - or one very formidable, and the other what you please - answering to the honoured and historic name of the Miss C- A-'s of Balnamoon.

title: Rob Roy - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "I long exceedingly for a return of my former dispatches to theSecretary's about Methven and Colll Urquhart, and my wife's cousins,Balnamoon and Phinaven.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis

title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: No doubt he condemned the excessive conviviality of Lairds of Balnamoon and the drinking bouts of Lord Panmure at Brechin Castle, yet there was a merry twinkle in his eye when he alluded to these scandals and to the lad who was told off to loosen the cravats of the boon companions who had slipped under the table.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: One of the chief leaders in Crawford'sarmy was John Collasse of Bonnymoon, (or Balnamoon,) who commanded agallant body of men, armed with bills and battle-axes, on whom the Earl greatlyrelied.
